record.title: MORNING BUSINESS

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I am going to ask unanimous consent that the Senate go into morning business. The managers of the bill may come and see if they can process some amendments, but we are not going to do that right now.
I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to a period of morning business, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the real.
The legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The Senator from Massachusetts is recognized.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I understand we are in a period for morning business.

record.chair: The Senator is correct, a 10-minute period during which to speak.
